byline.contributor: Ben Hubbard reported from Ankara and Ceylan Yeginsu from Istanbul.
byline.original: By BEN HUBBARD and CEYLAN YEGINSU

abstract: Turkish Pres Recep Tayyip Erdogan declares three-month state of emergency as his government tracks down suspects in failed coup attempt; state has been granted more powers to pass laws, and declaration follows mass purge of government institutions.

headline.print_headline: Turkish Leader Declares a State of Emergency

keywords.value: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
keywords.name: subject

snippet: President Recep Tayyip Erdogan said that he suspected foreign countries were involved in an attempt to topple his government....
lead_paragraph: President Recep Tayyip Erdogan said that he suspected foreign countries were involved in an attempt to topple his government.
